title: NASA Drop Test Supports Safer Air Taxi Design and Certification
summary: As the aviation industry works to develop new air taxis and other electric aircraft made from innovative, lightweight materials, there’s a growing need to understand how those materials behave under impact. That’s why NASA is investigating potential air taxi materials and designs that could best protect passengers in the event of a crash. On June […]

title: Hubble Spies Swirling Spiral
summary: The swirling spiral galaxy in this NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope image is NGC 3285B, which resides 137 million light-years away in the constellation Hydra (the Water Snake). Hydra has the largest area of the 88 constellations that cover the entire sky in a celestial patchwork. It’s also the longest constellation, stretching 100 degrees across the sky. It […]

title: A secretive space plane is set to launch and test quantum navigation technology
summary: "Testing this tech will be helpful for navigation in contested environments."

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to perform a static fire test of its Falcon 9 rocket ahead of the Crew-11 launch
summary: The test will follow the conclusion of a launch day rehearsal with the astronauts and cosmonaut in the loop, referred to as a dry dress rehearsal. The Crew-11 launch is scheduled for Thursday, July 31 at 12:09 p.m. EDT (1609 UTC).

title: Europe’s new carbon-monitoring mission launches on Vega-C
summary: The MicroCarb mission, led by the French space agency CNES, will monitor carbon dioxide in the atmosphere to help identify the world’s main sources and sinks of this important greenhouse gas. Launched on 25 July on a Vega-C rocket from Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana, the mission benefitted from the In-Orbit Demonstration and Validation (IOD/IOV) programme managed by the European Space Agency (ESA) on behalf of the European Commission.

title: Melissa John Champions Environmental Stewardship at White Sands
summary: For Melissa John, protecting the environment is her way of contributing to space exploration while preserving the Earth we call home.   As the sustainability program lead at NASA’s White Sands Test Facility in Las Cruces, New Mexico, John manages efforts to reduce waste, prevent pollution, and promote eco-conscious practices. Over the past 13 years, she […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 24 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The Starlink 17-2 mission will be SpaceX’s 92nd launch of 2025. It’s targeting liftoff of its Falcon 9 rocket from pad 4 East at 8:55 p.m. PDT (11:55 p.m. EDT / 0355 UTC).

title: Crew-11 astronauts, cosmonaut arrive in Florida ahead of launch to the space station
summary: The quartet is set to liftoff from Launch Complex 39A at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center on Thursday, July 31. Their Dragon spacecraft, Endeavour, will fly for a record-setting sixth time.
